title: Core77 Weekly Roundup (10-7-24 to 10-11-24)
description: Here's what we looked at this week:Project I-XRAY uses Meta's Ray-Ban 2 smart glasses to instantly access people's personal information. Unusual auto mods: Infinity taillights, and headlights with animated eyeballs.The Pi Foldable Lap Desk, for working/eating in cars.Cabin Anna, that house that slides open, goes into production. Do you have half a mil lying around?Google Japan's keyboard with a Möbius strip form factor.The Spider X1S, a large-format laser cutter with a compact form factor.The Nanobag Daypack: an expandable backpack that fits in a pocket.Making a silicone bag using Rapid Liquid Printing.Nike Grind Dumbbells are made with waste from the footwear manufacturing process.Massimo Modular's Model E9 is a thoroughly modern take on the modular home.Wine in flat-shaped plastic bottles: More sustainable?Hyundai's medical exoskeletons, designed for paraplegics and for injury rehabilitation.Industrial design case study: An espresso maker for Bosch, by ID firm Fluid.
author: Rain Noe
excerpt: Here's what we looked at this week: Project I-XRAY uses Meta's Ray-Ban 2 smart glasses to instantly access people's personal information. Unusual auto mods: Infinity taillights, and headlights with animated eyeballs. The Pi Foldable Lap Desk, for working/eating in cars.

html:
Core77 Weekly Roundup (10-7-24 to 10-11-24)

Here's what we looked at this week:

Project I-XRAY uses Meta's Ray-Ban 2 smart glasses to instantly access people's personal information.

Unusual auto mods: Infinity taillights, and headlights with animated eyeballs.

The Pi Foldable Lap Desk, for working/eating in cars.

Cabin Anna, that house that slides open, goes into production. Do you have half a mil lying around?

Google Japan's keyboard with a Möbius strip form factor.

The Spider X1S, a large-format laser cutter with a compact form factor.

The Nanobag Daypack: an expandable backpack that fits in a pocket.

Making a silicone bag using Rapid Liquid Printing.

Nike Grind Dumbbells are made with waste from the footwear manufacturing process.

Massimo Modular's Model E9 is a thoroughly modern take on the modular home.

Wine in flat-shaped plastic bottles: More sustainable?

Hyundai's medical exoskeletons, designed for paraplegics and for injury rehabilitation.

Industrial design case study: An espresso maker for Bosch, by ID firm Fluid.
